p:
However, poor agreement was found in other regions, namely in the tropical western Atlantic and Southern Ocean where an increase in δ 15N
org was not simulated. In the west Atlantic, Straub et al.
42 presented a compelling relationship between δ 15N and orbital precession, leading the authors to surmise a dependence on the upwelling of PO 4 via changes in the circulation. In the Southern Ocean, a glacial increase in δ 15N in Subantarctic
2 and Antarctic zones
43, 44 is explained by a weaker physical delivery of NO 3 to the mixed layer combined with Fe fertilisation. We therefore expected and found no response in both regions in these experiments (Supplementary Fig. 10) because the only change was an increase in dust-borne Fe and the Southern Ocean was made insensitive to increases in Fe supply.
